page.title: 08SEWAGE / PASTURE W.DRAYCOTT
page.content: A small {sewage works}containing two filter beds can be found in the NE corner of this square.There is a pair of houses on the main {Draycott} road.The{Derby/Nottingham}railway line and{River Derwent}intersect mixed fields of grazing land which covers the rest of the grid square.A herd of{ {Devon}cattle graze these fields.The hedgerows are overgrown and some show gaps at their bases.Wire fencing, following the hedgerows,limits the livestock movement.Some hedges have been removed to increase field size, but most natural land partitioning remains.There are a number of mature trees growing individually and in clumps near to hedgerows.
